poem:
"Story Upon the Morning Paper"

In a realm of inked-to-life tales,
Rebecca, born of Guangzhou trails.
Found Texas in her youthful bloom,
Then breathed in Didion's thoughtful plume.
The Poppy War, a tale so grave,
Bears soil-inked root where poppies wave.
With sequels two she let them soar,
A fourth one knocking on the door.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rebecca F Kuang: ‘I like to write to my friends in the style of Joan Didion’ Rebecca F Kuang, 27, is an American writer. She and her family emigrated to the US from Guangzhou, China, when she was four; she grew up in Dallas, Texas. Her first novel, The Poppy War, a grimdark fantasy with a plot drawn from elements of the second Sino-Japanese war, was published in 2018. Two sequels followed. A fourth novel,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
